Great pizza, great food, very friendly guys. We've loved them for years, and so glad to know they're surviving, and thriving, during the pandemic.
I don't know but $12.45 with tax seems like a bit much for 2 slices. Every time I go they have like big slices in the case and then cut it into 2 when you order it. It's like a bait and switch.
Certainly a spot worth stopping by, the food is great and well prepared, the pricing is convenient and it is constantly neat in here. Kudos.

Update October 2020: Be careful, today I got a reheated whole pie, could be a return from a mistake order. I find it totally gross and irresponsible amid covid19 to reheat and recycle pizzas after someone (perhaps a customer?) already opened the box. And: Some workers behind the counter wear the mask on their chin! Am done with Il Porto. Hasta la vista baby.
Great food!!! Friendly staff !!! Great service !!!
Excellent!
Amazing & great taste.
Good food. Music too.

Garlic knots hit, semi-attentive service because they are busy during lunch hours and the have a vegan pizza (I think it's vegan... I don't know about the crust but there is no cheese). Pizza there is slightly better than your every corner $1 slice. Staff is nice and chill, like people you want to have a beer with.
Phenomenal pizza! One of the best places in Brooklyn. I don't know how it is not on more top pizza lists.

We ordered a small Brooklyn pizza at the nearby vineyard. They delivered the wrong order twice in a row. They took the mistaken orders back to deliver to another person. Gross!!  We demanded our refund. Avoid them like the plague.
Excellent. Staff is great. The margarita with pepperoni is fantastic.
great service and the food is Delicious
Dan good food. And music too. I can't ask for more.
Grandma pie was delicious
Outdoor seating with live music Thursdays through Saturdays at 7pm. The grandma pie is my go to order and the garlic knots are amazing.
After years of ordering lunches here I have tried just about everything on the menu. The pizza is always is delicious and the pannini are great as well. Probably would starve without them!
One of the better quality pizza options in Fort Greene/Clinton Hill.
Great pizza.

Several of my friends have been eating there for years and love it. I went there for the first time last night for dinner. The outdoor ambiance was very nice. Spacious seating, lighting, live entertainment was perfect. There are a few reasons why they're only receiving 3 stars. The mussels were very disappointing,  actually they were the smallest mussels I've ever seen with more empty shells than mussels. The red marinara sauce was good. I asked for extra bread & never received it. I had to ask for extra napkins 3 times. I ordered yellow tuna with salad which was delicious however; I asked the waiter for fresh pepper & he came back with a salt & pepper shaker. I was shocked & said to my friend no he didn't. Well, I asked a woman waiting on another table if they have fresh pepper & she said sure. I realized he must be new. My waitor was friendly, but definitely needs additional training. He also put my utensils down without properly wiping the table. I said you shd wipe the table first before placing utensils & he apologized. I plan on giving them another chance because my grilled tuna & salad was delicious & my drink was good. I realize in Covid19 small business needs support.
Always good pizza and those guys r all cool
Good pizza, my favorite is procuitto with arugula.  The food is pretty good, great customer service.
Good service and good food.
Great place
Visiting from Philly, had an appointment nearby. Stumbled upon this place. Great food and great service! Thank you !
the food was inedible and the drinks were no good. But the service was pretty good. I got a lobster pasta dish, the lobster was pretty flavorless and my ceasar salad didnt make up for it.
I've been eating from this place every Friday for about 8+ years. Highly recommended. Great food. Great service.
Pizza is good place is clean
The food is spectacular.  Il Porto has some of the best Italian food that I ever had.  The owners are very personable and they are another reason why I have been a patron since 2014!

I visit this outstanding restaurant once a month because I love the  special atmosphere that is outline this place. The personel is awfuly loving and professional. The service is certainly fast. Also, the food they serve is highly distinguished. I came many times and I was always joyful. The payment is modest. I highly suggest this restaurant to my friends and family.
You can taste all the hours of love that went into making this food truly exceptional. Definitely makes quarantine more bearable
(Translated by Google) Exquisite well set and tremendous pizz @ 🍕  (Original) Exquisito bien ambientado y tremenda pizz@ 🍕

So glad Il Porto is still open. I can honestly say they have the best pizza in the area and even in these challenging times, the quality was as just as exceptional as during normal operations. Truly, they are an exemplary business in this city. I look forward many more years of enjoying their pizza

Best pizza on this side of BK by far. The supreme slice is off the charts. Everything is fresh

This is by far and away my favorite italian restaurant in Brooklyn. They have the best service and the best grandma pie on earth! Come check out Saturday nights for live music and a band! Anthony, Sal, Vinnie & the rest of the staff are wonderful! I highly recommend!!!!

Go to spot for when working in the studios across the street, best pizza in Brooklyn.

I had a horrible experience. Poor and rude phone manner from the owner. I asked for napkins with my pizza and when I called to discuss I was treated rudely and in a most curt manner. With the explanation that at night the food delivery orders do not com with napkins? The food is good but their business manner and phone etiquette leave something to be desired. Be warned if you like good food and rude customer service. This is the place for you.

I use to come this place when I worked at navy yard and we has good times for ok italian food and pizza. tonight we feel like to have some italian again and I was in the area thought I stop by and pick up some good old memories, but they disappointed me and also cause me to visited the ER. the entree veal I ordered was expired food, you can just tasted I had a small bite and spit out very quickly. The shrimp we ordered was over cooked and tasteless. we will never return again! watch out guys!
Pizza is of course perfect, and the cheesecake you have to get. Must have. Best italian in clinton hill currently.

Cannot say enough good things about this neighborhood treasure. Their pizza is divine, the desserts are so fresh they taste like they were made to order, and their wait staff are humble professionals.

I ordered a large shrimp with pasta plate. They only put 1 baby shrimp in the plate. For $20 it was a joke for a meal. Atleast i know not to eat there again

Hands down, one of THE BEST Italian restaurants in Bk if not the city, that also happens to serve amazing pizza. I honestly would stop by here for lunch almost everyday while working at Steiner studios. Great customer service, and you can feel the love from this family owned establishment. They take care of their regulars and truly appreciate knowing how much you love their hard work. This is a must if your near the Brooklyn navy yard or in Bk in general. Live music almost every evening is an added plus.  Great for groups, dates, and the quick drop in. Plenty of room inside and out.  My only advice would be to check out the menu online and order or call in 15 minutes for a sit down before coming in. The location is very popular and the kitchen is busy more often then not. This will save you time and get you eating much sooner then you would if you ordered when you get there. This piece of advice could  completely change your experience, especially if you have someplace to be afterward.  All in all, 5 stars.
Wonderful atmosphere, delicious food, fine dining experience. Our waitress was very experienced and knew the menu. Everyone enjoyed their meal.
good pizza, good value
good pizza, good value

If you are working at Steiner Studios there are not a lot of options for lunch. This is a great option no matter what. Good food, great staff,excellent service grab a quick slice or order from the menu. It's all good.

This is my go to spot when in Brooklyn.  The dining area has a nice warm feel to it with low lighting giving it that awesome romantic feel.  The food here is awesome.  I have been here many times before going on 10 years.  I moved to Miami but came back to visit.  I have to say the food is just as good, as if I never left.  To me that’s the true test of a great restaurant.  Had the clams oreganato.  Leaving me wanting more.  And for seafood lovers who never had a seafood pizza, than this is your spot.  A thin crusted pizza cooked to perfection with a delicious marinara sauce with clams, mussels, squid and shrimp.  I love this place, never had a bad dish yet.  Bravo Il Porto, keep up the great work.
The ambiance is simply amazing. I really enjoyed myself . The service is amazing however please note that if your ordering dinner there's a long wait time. The prices are reasonable.
Best margarita slice in the universe! Very saucy great crust

(Translated by Google) As an Italian, they can only say that it is the best place where I have eaten "Italian". One evening we had a pizza-based dinner and I must admit that even in Italy it is sometimes difficult to find such good pizzas, from parmigiana I also add that it was parmigiano-reggiano and prosciutto of excellent quality. Tonight we had a pasta-based dinner: one portion with salmon and one with pesto. I still don't understand why green beans in pesto XD, but both were excellent. As a dessert drowned in chocolate (ours in short, and I also doubt that they make it come from Italy) and cannoli. Good coffee, one of the best I've drunk in a week. All in a soft setting delighted by pleasant background music. TOP.  (Original) Da Italiana, possono solo dire che è il posto migliore dove io abbia mangiato "italiano". Una sera abbiamo cenato a base di pizza e devo ammettere che anche in Italia a volte si fatica a trovare pizze così buone, da parmigiana aggiungo anche che si trattava di parmigiano-reggiano e prosciutto di ottima qualità. Questa sera abbiamo cenato a base di pasta: una porzione al salmone ed una al pesto. Non ho capito ancora il perché dei fagiolini nel pesto XD, ma entrambe erano eccellenti. Come dessert affogato al cioccolato (il nostro insomma e mi viene anche il dubbio lo facciano venire dall'Italia) e cannoli. Caffè buono, uno dei migliori che abbia bevuto in una settimana insomma. Il tutto in una cornice soft deliziata da musica piacevole di sottofondo. TOP.
Delish from the dough! I'd go for a slice or pie or sit down dinner...all good!
Very quaint and cozy environment with excellent food and salad choices.
Loved it💜 👌 I had a wonderful experience

The Best

Easily the best pizza in this neighborhood and most likely some of the best in Brooklyn overall.   I am guessing the entrees are great too although I have yet to try them. I had a Margherita pizza and everything was delicious. From the buffalo mozzarella to the robust sauce to the crispy and light crust.  There were lots of flavors and textures in it.  a true sign of a quality slice of pizza  This makes Il Porto a destination for those who want some really good Italian cuisine all cooked in a wood oven by an obviously amazing chef.  I must return and try out some of the entrees. You need to go to Il Porto and you will return a lot once you dine there. Word.

Have literally eaten here since the first week that they opened and pretty much once or multiple times a week for years.  There is nothing on their menu that isn't delicious. Really you cannot go wrong with anything you order, Mario is am AMAZING chef. Here are some of my favorites and little tweeks I have made over the years. Let's start with brunch ... please for the love of God bring back your eggs benedict, they were the best I have ever had anywhere. My Husband David almost always orders the Purgatorio or Fiorentina Pizza. I usually go for the Steak & Eggs (but with poached eggs over the salad and some gorgonzola on the steak) or Il Porto Omelet. For Lunch I usually go with the Crab Croquette and the Cesare salad (add tomatoes + olives) or sometimes my Husband and I will share the Antipasto Misto and the Navy Yard pizza. For Dinner my go-to is Caprese to start and Suprema di Pollo. When I go for pasta I either go for Penne il Porto and change out the shrimp for grilled chicken or the Fettuccini al Pesto with grilled chicken. Great now I want to go here for dinner tonight but I'm in Connecticut lol.
I luv this place!
